Package controller

Class mainForm

java.lang.Object
controller.mainForm
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class mainForm extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This controller class allows to open multiple forms and to delete parts and products from the lists.

The mainForm class implements the Initializable interface and Provides control to the data flow into model objects and updates the view mainForm FXML file.

Author:
Myriam Drouin-Sagar

  • Method Details

    • getPartToModify

      public static Part getPartToModify()
      Gets the part selected by the user in the partsPane table view.
      Returns:
      the part object to modify

    • getProductToModify

      public static Product getProductToModify()
      Gets the product selected by the user in the productsPane table view.
      Returns:
      The product object to modify

    • onSearchPart

      public void onSearchPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Searches a part by id first, and then by partial or full name.

      Gets the value from the part's table view text field. Catches a NumberFormatException: if a string is found, the method will search for the partial name. If the text field searchPartText is empty, the table view is repopulated.

      If a part is found by id, the part object is highlighted in the table view. If a part is found by name, the part object is filtered in the table view. If not part is found an information message is displayed.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event generated by the Search button searchPartButton clicked by the user or passed from the keyEvent (never used)

    • onSearchPartText

      public void onSearchPartText(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent keyEvent)
      Calls the onSearchPart action event. This method allows the user to initiate the search with the keyboard (ENTER) and to empty the searchPartText field (backSpace).
      Parameters:
      keyEvent - The event generated when the user press the ENTER button on the keyboard and the focus is on the Search text field searchPartText

    • onSearchProduct

      public void onSearchProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Searches a product by id first, and then by partial or full name. It gets the values from the product's table view text field.

      This method catches a NumberFormatException: if a string is found, the method will search for the partial name. If the text field searchProductText is empty, the table view is repopulated.

      If a product is found by id, the product object is highlighted in the table view. If a product is found by name, the product object is filtered in the table view.

      If no product is found an information message is displayed.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event generated by the Search button searchProductButton pressed by the user or passed from the keyEvent (never used)

    • onSearchProductText

      public void onSearchProductText(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent keyEvent)
      Calls the onSearchProduct action event. This method allows the user to initiate the search with the keyboard (ENTER) and to empty the searchProductText field (backSpace).
      Parameters:
      keyEvent - The event generated when the user press the ENTER button on the keyboard and the focus is on the Search text field searchProductText

    • toAddPartForm

      public void toAddPartForm(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Loads the addPartForm controller class. It allows to open the addPartForm with the Add button (under the parts' table view) in the mainForm.

      RUNTIME ERROR: page failed to load the addPartForm on the action event, fixed by adding the controller.addPartForm to the addParForm FXML file.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event generated by the Add button addPartButton when clicked by the user
      Throws:
      IOException - from the FXMLoader

    • toModifyPartForm

      public void toModifyPartForm(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Loads the modifyPartForm controller class. It allows to open the modifyPartForm with the Modify button (under the parts' table view) in the mainForm.

      The static variable productToModify is assigned to the part selected by the user. An error message will be displayed if no part was selected.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event generated by the Modify button modifyPartButton when clicked by the user
      Throws:
      IOException - from the FXMLoader

    • toAddProductForm

      public void toAddProductForm(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Loads the addPartForm controller class. It allows to open the addProductForm with the Add button (under the products' table view) in the mainForm.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event generated by the Add button addProductButton when clicked by the user
      Throws:
      IOException - from the FXMLoader

    • toModifyProductForm

      public void toModifyProductForm(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Loads the modifyProductForm controller class. It allows to open the modifyProductForm with the Modify button (under the products' table view) in the mainForm.

      The static variable productToModify is assigned to the product selected by the user. An error message will be displayed if no product was selected.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event generated by the Modify button modifyProductButton when clicked by the user
      Throws:
      IOException - from the FXMLoader

    • onDeletePart

      public void onDeletePart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Removes a part from the ObservableList allParts by calling the deletePart method in the Inventory class.

      If no part is selected, an error message will be displayed. If a part is selected, a confirmation dialog box will be displayed to confirm the deletion.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event generated by the Delete button deletePartButton when clicked by the user (never used)

    • onDeleteProduct

      public void onDeleteProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Removes a product from the ObservableList allProducts by calling the deleteProduct method of the Inventory class. If no product is selected, an error message will be displayed. If a product is selected, a confirmation dialog box will be displayed to confirm the deletion.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event generated by the Delete button deleteProductButton when clicked by the user (never used)

    • onExit

      public void onExit(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Closes the application. A confirmation dialog box will be displayed to confirm the exit.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event generated by the Exit button exitButton when clicked by the user (never used)

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      First method to run in this controller class, and it populates the tables views. The initialize method is implemented by the Initializable class.

      Called when the FXMLoader calls the mainForm FXML file.

      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - The location used to retrieve relative paths for the root object (null if location unknown)
      resourceBundle - The resources used to localize the root object (null if root object not localized)
